recipe_name: Citrus turkey and sprout soy stir-fry
author: James Tanner
method: Blanch the Brussels sprouts in a pan of boiling salted water for 2-3 minutes until just tender. Drain well and when cool enough to handle peel away the outer layers and trim the ends. Cut each Brussels sprout into quarters. Heat a wok until smoking hot. Add the oil and the onion and stir fry for 1-2 minutes. Add the turkey and stir fry for 2-3 minutes until lightly browned. Add the garlic and the blanched sprouts and stir fry for 1-2 minutes, until heated through.  Pour in the orange juice and soy sauce and mix together. Sprinkle over the seasme seeds and then transfer to a warm serving plate. Garnish with the herbs and serve at once.
ingredients: 115g/4oz Brussels sprouts,  2 tbsp sunflower oil,  1 onion, thinly sliced,  2 turkey steaks, cut into strips,  2 garlic cloves, finely chopped,  Â½ orange, juice only,  2 tbsp dark soy sauce,  1 tsp sesame seeds,  handful chopped fresh mixed herbs (chives, parsley, coriander), to garnish
